page.title: 09Ecology south of Chitterne
page.content: The lanes and surrounding fields abound in rich vegetation and wild life. Since the farmers' awareness of the affect of weedkillers and insecticides on plants and animals, greater control is practised and this year has seen an abundance of primroses, foxgloves, campions, vetch, scabious, poppies and numerous other wild flowers; though the poor summer appears to have affected the butterfly population. Thick hedges and copses shelter a wide variety of birds and small animals. Foxes, badgers, roedeer, hedgehogs, hares, owls and toads are among the area's inhabitants, as well as large numbers of rooks, woodpigeons, moles and rabbits. There are wild fowl and duck on the winterbourne.
